com.isoterik.mgdx

Class Component

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.isoterik.mgdx.Component
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Collider, DebugRendererBase, GameObjectLocation2d, Physics2d, SpriteAnimator, SpriteRenderer, SteerableGameObject2d, Transform

    public class Component
extends java.lang.Object
    A Component is a functional piece of a GameObject. Every component is an isolated functionality that can be attached to a GameObject to give that functionality to that particular game object. To give functionality to a GameObject, you attach different components to it.

    Component instances are not reusable but several instances of one component can be attached to different game objects to share the same functionality.

    See Also:
    GameObject

    • Method Detail

      • attach

        public void attach()
        Called when this component is attached to a GameObject. Note: At this point it is guaranteed that a game object exists for this component but it is not guaranteed that the game object has been added to a Scene yet!

      • start

        public void start()
        Called when the host game object is added to a Scene. If the game object is already added to a scene before this component gets attached, this method will still be called (immediately after attach()) It is safe to make scene related calls here because a Scene instance exists. This is where you will typically do all initializations.

      • resume

        public void resume()
        Called when the Scene where the host game object resides is resumed. This is where you will typically resume music playbacks.

      • update

        public void update(float deltaTime)
        Called when the host game object needs to update.
        Parameters:
        deltaTime - the time difference between the current frame and the previous frame.

      • lateUpdate

        public void lateUpdate(float deltaTime)
        Called after all the components of the host game object have been updated. This is useful for tasks that depends on the updated state of game objects
        Parameters:
        deltaTime - the time difference between the current frame and the previous frame.

      • fixedUpdate

        public void fixedUpdate(float deltaTime)
        Called when the physics engine is updated. This is where you'll typically put physics related codes.
        Parameters:
        deltaTime - the time difference between the current frame and the previous frame.

      • resize

        public void resize(int newScreenWidth,
                   int newScreenHeight)
        Called when the screen is resized.
        Parameters:
        newScreenWidth - the new screen width
        newScreenHeight - the new screen height

      • render

        public void render(GameCamera gameCamera)
        Called when the Scene where the host game object resides wants to render
        Parameters:
        gameCamera - the camera used by the scene

      • drawDebugLine

        public void drawDebugLine(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShapeRenderer shapeRenderer,
                          GameCamera gameCamera)
        Called when the Scene where the host game object resides wants to render debug drawings of type ShapeRenderer.ShapeType.Line
        Parameters:
        shapeRenderer - a shape renderer to draw with
        gameCamera - the camera used by the scene

      • drawDebugFilled

        public void drawDebugFilled(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShapeRenderer shapeRenderer,
                            GameCamera gameCamera)
        Called when the Scene where the host game object resides wants to render debug drawings of type ShapeRenderer.ShapeType.Filled
        Parameters:
        shapeRenderer - a shape renderer to draw with
        gameCamera - the camera used by the scene

      • drawDebugPoint

        public void drawDebugPoint(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShapeRenderer shapeRenderer,
                           GameCamera gameCamera)
        Called when the Scene where the host game object resides wants to render debug drawings of type ShapeRenderer.ShapeType.Point
        Parameters:
        shapeRenderer - a shape renderer to draw with
        gameCamera - the camera used by the scene

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Called when the Scene where the host game object resides wants to pause. This is where you'll typically pause music playbacks.

      • detach

        public void detach()
        Called when this component is about to be detached from the host game object. The GameObject instance will become null after this method completes so this is the last place to communicate with the game object. It is usually a good idea to dispose component related resources here. Resources disposed here are usually the ones allocated in attach()

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Called when the host game object is removed from a Scene. scene and input instances becomes invalid after this method executes.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Called when the Scene where the host game object resides is getting destroyed. You should dispose all scene wide resources here.

      • componentAdded

        public void componentAdded(Component component)
        Called when a new component is attached to the host game object. Note: the new component will be added once this method completes and every other component is notified
        Parameters:
        component - the new component

      • componentRemoved

        public void componentRemoved(Component component)
        Called when an existing component is about to be detached from the host game object. Note: the new component will be detached once this method completes and every other component is notified
        Parameters:
        component - the new component

      • onCollisionEnter2d

        public void onCollisionEnter2d(Collision2d collision)
        Called when the host game object starts colliding in 2D space.
        Parameters:
        collision - the collision data

      • onCollisionExit2d

        public void onCollisionExit2d(Collision2d collision)
        Called when the host game object stops colliding in 2D space.
        Parameters:
        collision - the collision data

      • onSensorEnter2d

        public void onSensorEnter2d(Collision2d collision)
        Called when the host game object's sensor starts colliding in 2D space.
        Parameters:
        collision - the collision data

      • onSensorExit2d

        public void onSensorExit2d(Collision2d collision)
        Called when the host game object's sensor stops colliding in 2D space.
        Parameters:
        collision - the collision data

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Components can be disabled. This determines if it is enabled or not
        Parameters:
        enabled - is it enabled?

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Returns:
        whether this component is enabled or not

      • __setGameObject

        public void __setGameObject(GameObject gameObject)
        Sets the host GameObject. This method is called internally by the system and should never be called directly!
        Parameters:
        gameObject - host game object

      • __setHostScene

        public void __setHostScene(Scene scene)
        Sets the host Scene. This method is called internally by the system and should never be called directly!
        Parameters:
        scene - the scene where the host game object resides

      • getGameObject

        public GameObject getGameObject()
        Returns:
        the host game object

      • addComponent

        public void addComponent(Component component)
        Adds a component to the host game object.
        Parameters:
        component - the component

      • getComponent

        public <T extends Component> T getComponent(java.lang.Class<T> componentClass)
        Gets a component of a particular type that is attached to the host game object. Note: If there many components of the requested type, only the first one found will be returned. To get everything, use getComponents(Class) instead.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of component
        Parameters:
        componentClass - the class of the component
        Returns:
        the component found or null if none found

      • getComponents

        public <T extends Component> com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<T> getComponents(java.lang.Class<T> componentClass)
        Gets components of a particular type that is attached to the host game object.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of component
        Parameters:
        componentClass - the class of the component
        Returns:
        the components found or empty list if none found

      • getComponents

        public com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<Component> getComponents()
        Returns:
        all the components attached to the host game object including this one.

      • hasComponent

        public <T extends Component> boolean hasComponent(java.lang.Class<T> componentClass)
        Checks if a component of a particular type is attached to the host game object.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of component
        Parameters:
        componentClass - the class of the component
        Returns:
        true if a component of such type exists. false otherwise

      • hasComponent

        public boolean hasComponent(Component component)
        Checks if a component is attached to the host game object.
        Parameters:
        component - the component to check.
        Returns:
        true if a component of such type exists. false otherwise

      • removeComponent

        public <T extends Component> boolean removeComponent(java.lang.Class<T> componentClass)
        Removes the first component found for a particular type that is attached to the host game object. Note: a component can remove itself.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of component
        Parameters:
        componentClass - the class of the component
        Returns:
        true if a component of such type is removed. false otherwise

      • removeComponents

        public <T extends Component> void removeComponents(java.lang.Class<T> componentClass)
        Removes all component of a particular type that is attached to the host game object. Note: a component can remove itself.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of component
        Parameters:
        componentClass - the class of the component

      • removeComponent

        public boolean removeComponent(Component component)
        Removes a component attached to the host game object. Note: a component can remove itself.
        Parameters:
        component - the component to remove.
        Returns:
        true if the component was removed. false otherwise

      • removeGameObject

        public boolean removeGameObject(GameObject gameObject,
                                Layer layer)
        Removes a game object from the host scene. This will have no effect if there is no existing host scene.
        Parameters:
        gameObject - the game object.
        layer - the layer where the game object is added.
        Returns:
        whether the game object was removed.

      • removeGameObject

        public boolean removeGameObject(GameObject gameObject,
                                java.lang.String layerName)
        Removes a game object from the host scene. This will have no effect if there is no existing host scene.
        Parameters:
        gameObject - the game object.
        layerName - the name of the layer where the game object is added.
        Returns:
        whether the game object was removed.

      • removeGameObject

        public boolean removeGameObject(GameObject gameObject)
        Removes a game object from the host scene. This will have no effect if there is no existing host scene.
        Parameters:
        gameObject - the game object.
        Returns:
        whether the game object was removed.
